entry.title: Nasdaq Eyeing Q2 2023 Release For Bitcoin And Crypto Custody Platform
entry.summary:
The exchange giant is joining Fidelity and BNY Mellon in the pursuit of their own cryptocurrency custody platform.
Nasdaq, an American stock exchange based in New York City, is reportedly looking at Q2 2023 for the release of its custody services for Bitcoin and other cryptocurrencies.¬† In an interview with Bloomberg, Senior Vice President and Head of Nasdaq Digital Assets Ira Auerbach said that Nasdaq ‚Äúis pushing ahead to get all the necessary technical infrastructure and regulatory approvals in place.‚Äù The report describes an infrastructure that might look similar to that of Fidelity Digital Assets, which quietly opened its operations to the public last week. The first step to bitcoin and cryptocurrency trading on Nasdaq would be the custody service for the assets. According to the Bloomberg report, ‚ÄúNasdaq has applied to the New York Department of Financial Services for a limited-purpose trust company charter, which would oversee the new business.‚Äù Launching just as several major cryptocurrency firms have collapsed, amidst increasing regulatory tension, the goal is seemingly to offer those customers who now have no platform, a regulated, well-trusted American service for bitcoin. It should be noted that many of the issues surrounding exchanges come from the third-party risks presented by a custodian holding bitcoin for customers. The most secure way to interact with bitcoin is to self-custody it with your own wallet. Although trading platforms do offer the ease of interaction created by custodianship, with the American financial system seeing precarious headlines as of late, it is important to consider these trade offs compared with traditional bitcoin self-custody.

entry.title: Deutsche Bank Shares Plunge, Default Insurance Soars Amid More Banking Panic
The Role of Blockchain in Authenticating and Provenance Art
entry.summary:
For millennia, art has been respected and revered as a form of expression. Collectors, museums, and art fans frequently see a painting, sculpture, or other type of artistic creation as a major investment.

However, one of the most difficult issues confronting the art industry is the issue of authenticity and provenance. The good news is that blockchain technology is now being used to remedy this issue.

In this post, we'll look at how blockchain technology is being used to authenticate and prove the provenance of art.

What exactly is Blockchain Technology?

Blockchain technology is a distributed ledger system that enables transactions to be safe, transpa‚Ä¶

entry.title: Ethereum‚Äôs Potential Rivalries: Exploring the Competition Among Smart Contract Platforms
entry.summary:
Ethereum, the second-largest cryptocurrency by market capitalization, is known for its smart contract capabilities, which enable for the development of decentralized applications (dApps) on its blockchain.

However, as blockchain technology becomes more widely used, other smart contract platforms are emerging as possible competitors to Ethereum. In this post, we will look at the competition among smart contract platforms as well as Ethereum's possible competitors.

Smart Contract Platform on Ethereum

Ethereum's smart contract platform is one of the industry's most established and widely used. It's been used to build dApps in a variety of industries, including finance, gaming, a‚Ä¶

entry.title: Biggest Movers: XMR Rises to 1-Month High, XRP Moves 4% Lower
entry.summary:
Monero jumped to a one-month high on Friday, as overall sentiment in crypto markets remained largely unchanged. The global market cap is now trading 0.60% higher at the time of writing. Xrp was back in the red in today‚Äôs session, as traders continued to secure recent gains.
Monero (XMR)
Monero (XMR) has been one of today‚Äôs biggest gainers, with prices climbing to a four-week high.
Following a low of $152.16 on Thursday, XMR/USD raced to a peak of $163.10 earlier in the day.
As a result of the move, XMR climbed to its strongest point since February 20, when the token reached a peak of $168.70.
Looking at the chart, the move came as monero rose beyond a key resistance level at the $155.00 mark.
Earlier momentum has somewhat eased, which comes as the 14-day relative strength index (RSI) collided with a ceiling at 58.00
At the time of writing, the index is tracking at 58.84, with XMR marginally lower than its earlier high. It is now trading at $160.65.
XRP
XRP, formerly ripple, extended declines on Friday, as traders continued to secure profits following recent highs.
XRP/USD dropped to a bottom of $0.4246 in today‚Äôs session, which comes a day after a peak at $0.4536.
Today‚Äôs drop comes three days after XRP hit a peak at $0.4940, which was its strongest point since last November.
This latest decline comes as the RSI fell below a ceiling at the 64.00 mark, and is now tracking at 57.31.
Despite the slip in sentiment, bulls rejected a breakout from a floor of $0.4250, with XRP now trading at $0.4264.
There will likely be another attempt to push prices under this mark, however should this point of support hold, there could be a reversal during the weekend.
Register your email here to get weekly price analysis updates sent to your inbox:
Do you expect xrp to move higher in upcoming days? Let us know your thoughts in the comments.

entry.title: What is a Wallet? Guide to storing Bitcoin
entry.summary: After you receive bitcoin, you‚Äôll need to store it in a secure digital wallet. This guide helps you understand what a wallet is and how there are different wallets to suit your needs. A wallet is where you typically store your bitcoin after purchase, just like a physical wallet is used to keep your cash and cards. Once you understand bitcoin and are ready to buy it, earn it or receive it as payment in exchange for goods and services, you should set up a wallet so that your counterpart has a digital address to send the bitcoin to. Your wallet must also be secure and robust for storing your bitcoin. Nowadays, there are plenty of digital wallets to choose from and this guide offers comprehensive information to help you make the right choice. Wallets can be hardware-based or software-based, ‚Ä¶

entry.title: Big Brands Get Serious About NFTs: Salesforce, VW, Panerai, Absolute Labs at NFT Paris
entry.summary: On this panel from NFT Paris 2023 moderated by Decrypt's Dan Roberts, Web3 leads from some of the largest consumer and tech brands discuss their NFT strategies. Marc Mathieu of Salesforce, Tim Walther of VW Group, Eva Assayag of Panerai, and Samir Addamine of Absolute Labs joined the panel.

entry.title: NFT Entertainment Revolution: Warner Bros, Orange Comet, CyberBrokers and NFT Now at NFT Paris
entry.summary: At NFT Paris 2023, Decrypt‚Äôs Stephen Graves moderated a discussion about NFTs and the entertainment industry with Warner Bros‚Äô NFT head Josh Hackbarth, CyberBrokers founder Josie Bellini, NFT Now founder Matt Medved and Dave Broome, CEO of Orange Comet, which has produced NFTs for Anthony Hopkins and The Walking Dead.

entry.title: Step Inside the Armory of the NFT Collective 'Knights Who Say Nah'
entry.summary: Knights Who Say Nah co-founder and project lead Nick Richey chats with Decrypt's Jason Nelson inside the group's armory of artifacts, shows off a historic Japanese tanto sword, and discusses why the preservation of historical artifacts is the best use case for NFTs.

entry.title: Voltz Labs CEO: DeFi Innovation Is Moving Offshore Because of US Regulatory Severity
entry.summary: Voltz Labs Co-founder and CEO Simon Jones talks to Decrypt's Jason Nelson at ETH Denver about using DeFi for interest rate swaps, the unfriendly regulatory environment in the US right now, emerging economies becoming crypto hubs, and the "cartoonishly large" market opportunity for DeFi.

entry.title: MoonPay CEO: Next Phase of NFT Adoption Will Come From 'Brands You Love in Your Everyday Life'
entry.summary: MoonPay CEO Ivan Soto-Wright talked to Decrypt's Liam Kelly at NFT Paris about how NFTs are clearly not "waning," how MoonPay works with brands like Puma and Nike to manage their Web3 plays and smart contracts, and how NFTs and crypto will go mainstream when they can integrate in our daily lives‚Äîand his prediction that brands will drive that.

entry.title: Framework Ventures Is 'Optimistic That Regulators Are Much More Educated' About Crypto Than in Past
entry.summary: Brandon Potts, a principal at Web3 VC firm Framework Ventures, spoke to Decrypt's Jason Nelson at ETH Denver about his investment focus, his outlook on crypto regulation right now, and why he's optimistic for the industry even amid the bear market and recent regulatory actions.

entry.title: Why LAL Art Has 'No Interest In Just Putting the Traditional Art Market on the Blockchain'
entry.summary: Fanny Lakoubay, the founder of art advisory and agency LAL Art, talked to Decrypt's Liam Kelly at NFT Paris about what LAL Art does, how it works with artists, museums, directors, and galleries, and why artists in Web3 have to "reinvent themselves every six months."

entry.title: Collab.Land Grew 'Because of Covid' Creating Need for DAO Tools: Co-founder Anjali Young
entry.summary: Anjali Young, the co-founder of Abridged and Collab.Land, talked to Decrypt's Jason Nelson at ETH Denver about the origins of Collab.Land and says it erupted thanks to Covid, which created not just new interest in crypto but the need for better tools for DAO member collaboration.

entry.title: Artist Mat Collishaw is Exploring the 'Mutability' of NFTs
entry.summary: Visual artist Mat Collishaw, who uses mixed media to explore beauty, is about to launch Heterosis, a metaverse art experience with dynamic NFTs hosted by OG.Art. He spoke to Decrypt's Dan Roberts at NFT Paris about how he came to Web3.

entry.title: Absolute Labs CEO: Big Brands Are Trying to Understand and Harness Crypto Wallets
entry.summary: Samir Addamine, Co-founder and CEO of Web3 CRM software company Absolute Labs, told Decrypt's Dan Roberts at NFT Paris that big consumer brands are rushing to figure out crypto wallets and how they can harness them for their marketing purposes and to deepen ties with customers.

entry.title: NFT Collector Gmoney: 'Marketplaces Have Nothing to Trade Without Creators'
entry.summary: Pseudonymous NFT collector Gmoney talks to Decrypt's Dan Roberts at NFT Paris about his Web3 luxury brand 9dcc, big brands getting into NFTs, the debate over creator royalty fees, and what will come next to the space.

entry.title: Head of Product for IEX's Dispatch: 'We See Tokens as the Social Graph of Web3'
entry.summary: Dispatch is a new Web3 marketing, messaging, and ad tech tool from IEX Group, which also owns the IEX exchange fighting high-frequency trading and made famous in the book "Flash Boys" by Michael Lewis. Dispatch head of product Sean Spector sat down with Decrypt's Liam Kelly at NFT Paris to talk about Dispatch's product vision and why Web2 companies are jumping into Web3.

entry.title: Community Gaming CEO: Ethereum Smart Contracts Can Solve 'Pain Points' of Gamers Getting Paid
entry.summary: Chris Gonsalves, CEO of esports tournament platform Community Gaming, talks to Decrypt's Jason Nelson at ETH Denver about Web3 gaming, his past stint at ConsenSys, and using smart contracts to get gamers paid instantly. Community Gaming has also just announced the 3XP Gaming Expo, June 8-9 in Pasadena, CA.

entry.title: gm: Neal Stephenson Maps Out the Metaverse
entry.summary: Neal Stephenson coined the term ‚Äúmetaverse‚Äù in his seminal 1992 sci-fi hit novel ‚ÄúSnow Crash.‚Äù Now he‚Äôs helming a metaverse blockchain company called Lamina1 and advocating for one free and open metaverse. He spoke to Dan Roberts and Stephen Graves at length about what he got right and wrong in ‚ÄúSnow Crash,‚Äù goggles and flat screens, Big Tech, NFTs and digital ownership, and more. Watch and make sure to subscribe to the gm podcast on Apple or Spotify.

entry.title: Fireblocks Is Laser-Focused on the Picks and Shovels: Web3 Products Lead at ETH Denver
entry.summary: Omer Amsel, head of Web3 products at crypto custody and settlement provider Fireblocks, told Decrypt's Jason Nelson at ETH Denver about why crypto market cycles are best for building, how Fireblocks is focused on providing "picks and shovels," and why the company still believes in the long-term promise of Web3.

entry.title: CEO of Video Streaming Platform Beem: Decentralization Lets 'Creators Regain Their Autonomy'
entry.summary: Mihai Crasneanu, Co-founder and CEO of Beem, describes Beem as "a mix of YouTube, Twitch, Zoom, and Clubhouse" that runs as a decentralized platform. He talked to Decrypt's Stephen Graves at NFT Paris about how it all works and how the platform is growing.

entry.title: 'Calladita' Director Says NFT Funding Model He Used Is Already Gone Because Web3 Moves So Fast
entry.summary: Miguel Faus funded his upcoming film "Calladita" via NFT sales and a prize grant from Decentralized Pictures and Steven Soderbergh. He told Decrypt's Stephen Graves at NFT Paris about how the film process is progressing and how Web3 moves so quickly that the NFT funding model he used is already a thing of the past and other filmmakers need to find other ways to keep pushing the envelope.

entry.title: Coinbase Protocols Lead Talks Plans for Base and NFT Marketplace
entry.summary: Coinbase protocols lead Jesse Pollak sat down with Decrypt's Jason Nelson at ETH Denver 2023 to talk about the company's innovation strategy and its plans to keep "iterating quickly" on products like Coinbase NFT and its newly announced Layer-2 blockchain Base and its efforts to become an "on-chain-native company."

entry.title: How CyberBrokers Creates Quests Across Multiple NFT Communities: Josie Bellini
entry.summary: Josie Bellini, NFT artist and creator of CyberBrokers, tells Decrypt's Stephen Graves at NFT Paris how CyberBrokers creates "missions and quests" for its holders to complete that lead them to other hubs like Cryptovoxels, Mona, and other projects "so that we're not just in our own silo."
